channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Newborns living near trees tend to be healthier: New data suggests it's not because healthier people reside near parks
item.description: The link between proximity to greenspace -- including trees and parks-- and healthy birth outcomes is well established. Now new data adds to our under...

item.title: Family dynamics shape body image differently across cultures
item.description: Body appreciation differs between Middle-Eastern and Western societies, a new international study can reveal, highlighting how cultural and family inf...

item.title: New porous crystal catalyst offers durable, efficient solution for clean hydrogen production

item.title: 'Periodic table of machine learning' could fuel AI discovery
item.description: After uncovering a unifying algorithm that links more than 20 common machine-learning approaches, researchers organized them into a 'periodic table of...

item.title: World on course to trigger multiple climate 'tipping points' unless action accelerates
item.description: Multiple climate 'tipping points' are likely to be triggered if global policies stay on their current course, new research shows.

item.title: Atmospheric winds have surprising impact on ocean weather

item.title: 10 billion Milky Way stars might have habitable exoplanets after all

item.title: NSF launches new sexual assault crisis helpline for research community

item.title: Molecular nanocages remove 80-90% of PFAS, or 'forever chemicals,' from water

item.title: NSF expands access to advanced cloud computing for scientific research
